description.narrative: The most significant, expected project-level impacts are derived from (i) increased access to finance to underserved and vulnerable segments of the population in Colombia comprising pensioners and microentrepreneurs; and (ii) providing access to the domestic bond markets to Credifinanciera, changing significantly its ability to obtain long term financing. Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the project will promote the development of an alternative bond market in Colombia allowing medium sized companies to have access to bonds and consequently deepening the capital markets locally. Additionally, the project will promote the market adoption of a business model that effectively provides access to finance to the elderly, an underserved and fragile group countrywide.

The proposed project consists of subscribing senior bonds to Creditos y Ahorro Credifinanciera S.A. (Credifinanciera or the Company) for up to COP 35,000 million (approximately US$11 million) to support the growth of the Companys microenterprise and pensioners loan portfolio. IFCs financial support and mobilization efforts should send a positive signal to the market, as it would provide medium-to-long term financing through a bond issuance aimed at targeted institutional investors, ultimately deepening financial and capital markets in Colombia (the Country).
